intro: Scolopia maoulidae, commonly known as the Maoulid's spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems covered in a waxy coating. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Scolopia maoulidae is known for its latex-producing properties, which can be toxic if ingested.
